contentfulPost.title: Compelling Links Between Depression and Gut Inflammation

body.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"A number of studies have confirmed that gastrointestinal inflammation can play a critical role in the development of depression, and that healthy bacteria may be an important part of the treatment. This leaves a void that is filled by disease-causing pathogenic bacteria, yeast and fungi that instead promote inflammation","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Other research has shown the probiotic Lactobacillus rhamnosus has a marked effect on GABA levels — an inhibitory neurotransmitter involved in regulating many physiological and psychological processes — in certain brain regions, lowering the stress-induced hormone corticosterone.
